item.title: Walking Npc's Help
item.dc:creator: @veikron veikron
item.description:
@veikron wrote:

lets see if i can explain ok well if u open up ur autospawn.cfg (pilfe of books) right click open with notepad
there should be lots of lines like spawn = 50 1111 1111 1111 1111 1 cept with different numbers
the first 3 numbers is first is the 50 means it a kbd the next 2 is the spawning spot the next one is walking ones so if u want it to walk in like a square find the northest cordinate and put it in the 4th number then find the southwest cord and put in the 5th cord then change the 1 (walking type) to a… uh idk something different that means walk lol

Read full topic

item.title: Walking Npc's Help
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

//------NpcID---CoordX--CoordY--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Descrption spawn = 494 3254 3418 0 0 0 0 0 1 Varrock West Banker

Compared to:

//------NpcID---CoordX--CoordY--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Descrption spawn = 494 3254 3418 0 3250 3414 3258 3422 1 Varrock West

The second one will allow the NPC to move 4 east, west, north or south from its spawn location.

PS: Sorry it was RangeX1 not x1-range. Sorry about that, but same ordeal. Just change the Range numbers to how far you want to allow it to move.

Read full topic

item.title: Walking Npc's Help
item.dc:creator: @alpha2 .alpha
item.description:
@alpha2 wrote:

//------NpcID---CoordX--CoordY--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Descrption spawn = 494 3254 3418 0 0 0 0 0 1<--This set to one = walk 0 = dont move Varrock West Banker

Lol sorry, I don’t have a source on my pc anymore. I switched to Ubuntu, but supply me with a example autospawn.

Just one line of it and I will show you. Like the:

spawn = # # #  blah blah etc..

And I will show you.

Read full topic

item.title: Walking Npc's Help
item.dc:creator: @Zuno Zuno
item.description:
@Zuno wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:2, topic:229457”]No… but I can tell you

In autospawn.cfg there is x1-range, x2-range, y1-range, y2-range or what ever. This is how far the NPC can move.

Normally, you could put like -4, +4 (I think its a good number) on each onto the X, Y of the npc. So like: x1-range would be -4 of the x and x2 would be +4. Etc etc

PS: Don’t hold me to the correct names, but it’s something along those lines. I forget… I haven’t touched P servers in a while.[/quote]

I R confused. lol

Read full topic

item.title: Walking Npc's Help
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

No… but I can tell you

In autospawn.cfg there is x1-range, x2-range, y1-range, y2-range or what ever. This is how far the NPC can move.

Normally, you could put like -4, +4 (I think its a good number) on each onto the X, Y of the npc. So like: x1-range would be -4 of the x and x2 would be +4. Etc etc

PS: Don’t hold me to the correct names, but it’s something along those lines. I forget… I haven’t touched P servers in a while.
